doc:
Colleen Clifford https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colleen_Clifford 0 Irene Margaret Clifford (née Blackford) (17 November 1898 – 7 April 1996), professionally known as Colleen Clifford, was a British-born performer, who worksd in England as well as in Australia in radio, stage, television and film as an actress, she was also a theatre director and producer, coloratura soprano, dancer, comedian and classical pianist who was a specialist in voice production, drama and music. In a career spanning nearly eight decades, she was one of the most popular actresses who later became known as the grand dame and matriarch of the entertainment profession and performing arts. Clifford started her career in her native United Kingdom where was an early radio and television performer for the British Broadcasting Corporation during the 1930s and 1940s hosting cabaret and variety shows, and during the Second World War, becoming a feature of news broadcasting and war concerts. Clifford was, at one time, featured on a 15-minute radio show showcasing her singing and musical performances. After emigrating to Australia in 1954, she was a highly recognizable character actress of stage and subsequently television in series and mini-series and in films. Irene_Margaret_Clifford ( née_Blackford ) ( 17_November_1898 – 7_April_1996 ) , professionally_known as Colleen_Clifford , was a_British-born_performer , who worksd in England_as_well_as in Australia in radio_,_stage_,_television_and_film as an_actress , she was also a_theatre_director_and_producer_,_coloratura_soprano , dancer , comedian and classical_pianist who was a_specialist in voice_production , drama_and_music . In a_career spanning nearly_eight_decades , she was one of the_most_popular_actresses who later became_known as the_grand_dame_and_matriarch of the_entertainment_profession and performing arts . Clifford started her_career in her_native_United_Kingdom where was an_early_radio_and_television_performer for the_British_Broadcasting_Corporation during the_1930s_and_1940s hosting cabaret_and_variety_shows , and during the_Second_World_War , becoming a_feature of news_broadcasting_and_war_concerts . Clifford was , at one_time , featured on a_15-minute_radio show_showcasing her_singing_and_musical_performances . After emigrating to Australia in 1954 , she was a_highly_recognizable_character_actress of stage and subsequently television in series_and_mini-series and in films .
